name: What Do You Mean? Quiz / Test | Wordplay for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Some people say it is like taking candy FORM a baby.
questions.explanation:
From.

	From represents where something originates.  For instance, I come FROM Colorado, which means that it where I was originally located. Form means something completely different.  A form is a type of paper you may have to fill out, whether it's to buy something, to do something, etc.

questions.text: While playing catch, I like to WORTH the ball as far as I can.
questions.explanation:
Throw.

	To throw means to propel something, such as if you throw a ball.  If you throw something as far as you can, you probably used as much strength as you could to propel it forward. Worth is how valuable something is.  If something is worth a lot of money, then, it is probably pretty valuable.

questions.text: I usually go to bed at ten o'clock at THING.
questions.explanation:
Night.

	Night is a time during the day when the sun is down and it is dark outside.  Most people sleep during the night, though there are some people who sleep during the daytime and are awake at night. Thing has a lot of definitions.  It can be a word that is a very vague description of something.  It is usually used as a noun, and can mean any item.  For instance, right now, I see a blanket.  I could point to it and call it "that thing".

questions.text: I was filled with much ADDER as I climbed to the top of the roof.
questions.explanation:
Dread.

	Dread is a word that means fear; for instance, when "Jaws" first came out, many people dreaded going in the water, because the movie was scary. An adder is a type of snake.

questions.text: Monkeys have tails, but PEAS do not.
questions.explanation:
Apes.

	Both monkeys and apes are types of primates, but monkeys have tails.  Apes, though, like gorillas and orangutans, do not have tails. Peas are little green vegetables that usually come in a pod.

questions.text: I really enjoy karaoke, because I love to SIGN songs.
questions.explanation:
Sing.

	To sing is to use the voice to make music.  There are a lot of famous singers who sing a lot of different types of music. A sign is something that shows you the way, or gives you a command, or advertises something.  A roadsign, for instance, shows you some rules you may need to know while you are driving.  A restaurant sign may draw you towards it, wanting to eat at that restaurant.

questions.text: I really like eating my BEARD with butter and jam.
questions.explanation:
Bread.

	Bread is something you eat, and is typically made from grains.  There are many kinds of bread: wheat, white, rye, pumpernickel, and sourdough, to name only a few.  Bread is also a slang term for money, and the name of a band! A beard is hair grown on the chin.  Some men like to wear beards, while others like to shave their beards regularly.

questions.text: I needed help with my math homework, so my mom hired a TROUT to help me.
questions.explanation:
Tutor.

	A tutor is someone who helps others with their work, particularly with schoolwork.  A math tutor would help with math, then, and a science tutor would help with science, etc.  Sometimes the school has volunteer tutors that help kids with their work, but sometimes they do not, and you have to hire one. Trout is a type of fish that comes in all different species, like rainbow or my favorite, Colorado greenback cutthroat trout.

questions.text: In order to catch the school bus, sometimes one needs to wake up LAYER.
questions.explanation:
Early.

	When something is early, it is sooner than intended.  For instance, if you arrive to a party early, you got there before it started. Layer can mean many things.  Someone who makes brick houses is called a bricklayer, because they lay bricks side by side and stack them to make walls.  A layer is also a part of something, like a layer of a cake.

questions.text: I only ate TRAP of my pizza, because I got too full to finish it.
questions.explanation:
Part.

	Part is a word that represents only some of an entire item.  In this instance, I only ate part of the pizza, which means I was not able to eat the entire thing; only some of it. A trap is something designed to catch something.  A mousetrap catches mice, bear traps catch bears, etc.  Traps are not only for animals, though.  Perhaps you've been caught in a trap before!
